name: Titanium.UI.EmailDialog
summary: An email dialog is a modal window that allows users to compose and send an email.

events.name: complete
events.summary: Fired when this email dialog has completed sending an email.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Indicates if the email was handled successfully. Returns true if request succeeded, false otherwise. Note that emails being deleted or saved for later do count as success.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message, if any returned. Will be undefined if success is true.

properties.name: code
properties.summary: Error code. Error code will be 0 if success is true, nonzero otherwise. If the error was generated by the operating system, that system's error value is used. Otherwise, this value will be -1.

properties.name: result
properties.summary:
Status of the email send process.

The SAVED and CANCELLED constants are iOS only.

On Android, this property will return SENT when the user discards or saves a message.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

methods.name: addAttachment
methods.description:
On Android, multiple attachments may be added, but will only work if the user chooses to send via the Android Gmail or K9 mail clients.

The Android "Mail" app, which is only available on some handsets, will only accept one attachment from a Titanium app.

methods.name: isSupported
methods.summary: Indicates whether sending email is supported by the system.
methods.description: On iOS 10, the user is able to uninstall the built-in applications including Mail. Because of that, you should ensure to check if the email dialog is supported on the current device.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary: Supported on iOS only. Simple object to override animation. Note that the default here is equivalent to passing in { animated: true } (while typically the default for AnimatedOptions is false)

properties.name: barColor
properties.summary: Bar color of the email dialog window, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: bccRecipients
properties.summary: Recipients of the email included via the BCC (Blind Carbon Copy) field.

properties.name: ccRecipients
properties.summary: Recipients of the email included via the CC (Carbon Copy) field.

properties.name: html
properties.summary: Determines whether the email message, specifically the contents of messageBody, should be sent as HTML content type rather than plain text.

properties.name: toRecipients
properties.summary: Recipients of the email included via the main TO field.

constants.name: CANCELLED
constants.summary: Constant for the CANCELLED status result. On Android, this property exists but is not used.

constants.name: SAVED
constants.summary: Constant for the SAVED status result. On Android, this property exists but is not used.
